alert.note: Alert for Fisher; Jones; Nolan (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 26 at 7:38PM CST by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Jones, northern Nolan and Fisher Counties through 830 PM CST... At 737 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles north of Rotan to near Us- 180 Near The Fisher- Scurry County Line to Colorado City. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sweetwater, Hamlin, Roscoe, Rotan, Roby, Sylvester, Neinda, Noodle, Hobbs, Mccaulley, Wastella, Longworth, Champion, The Intersection Of Us- 180 And Ranch Road 126, Hitson, Gannon, Lake Sweetwater, Busby, Capitola and The Intersection Of Highway 70 And Ranch Road 53. This includes Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 229 and 260. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
